subject: Photography
title: What Makes a Photograph Art?
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Makes a Photograph Art? usable.

hook.text: Is every photograph art? Is any photograph art? The debate has raged since the camera was invented.

buildup.text: Early critics dismissed photography as mere mechanical reproduction â€” a machine, not an artist, made the image.

discovery.text: But the photographer chooses subject, timing, framing, and light. Those choices are creative decisions â€” art.

twist.text: Not every painting is art. Not every photograph is either. Intent, craft, and vision separate snapshots from art.

climax.text: Photography became accepted as fine art in the 20th century. Today it hangs in every major museum worldwide.

punchline.text: The camera is a tool. What makes it art is the person behind it.

quiz.question: What transforms a photograph from a snapshot into art?
options: The photographer's intentional creative choices in subject, timing, and vision
Only black and white photographs are art
